page.title: 11CHARLTON-HANK.ECOLOGY 1
page.content: A{low-lying}area.Altitude 79-114m. East-west ridge a watershed. Streams in North flow into Swillbrook and eventually the Thames.Stream in South flows into the Avon.Mainly{Oxford Clay and Cornbrash;area of Acidic Greensand at Flisteridge Wood.Charlton stands on porous Oolite rock which is 300'down called Midford Sands.A pumping station at Charlton is an artesian{well. Disused wells are common on older properties.Average annual rainfall 912mm.Average temp.4C Jan-16C July. Prevailing wind from South-West often strong.High water table contributes to fog.{Footpaths}Hankerton converging on Church and farms.Charlton linking B4040 and C92 and through Bullocks Horn to Charlton Church,now used for recreational purposes.Field boundaries dry stone walls,ditches and very old hedgerows.
